results.title: Joanie 4 Jackie
results.brief_description: In 1995 Miranda July dropped out of college, moved to Portland, Oregon, and typed up a pamphlet that she imagined would be the start of a revolution of girls and women making movies and sharing them with each other. The pamphlet said: “A challenge and a promise: Lady, you send me your movie and I’ll send you the latest Big Miss Moviola Chainletter Tape.” The Joanie 4 Jackie project involved zines, chainletter tapes, co-star tapes and events.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes

results.title: Joan Sutherland: who's afraid of opera: "The Barber of Seville"
results.creator_credit: Nathan Kroll, Phoenix Films, Kroll Productions and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Joan Sutherland explains the story of the opera “The Barber of Seville” to an audience of three hand puppets. Together with other singers, she performs excerpts from the work. This film is suitable for all ages. Musical direction by Richard Bonygne and performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.

results.title: Joan Sutherland: A Life on the Move
results.brief_description: This video looks at the life of Joan Sutherland, following her around the world as she fulfils performing and recording engagements. It looks at her recording in the studio, performing in operatic productions, relaxing at home in London and in Switzerland, enjoying a barbecue with her family and playing with her grandchild. Rated: G

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Peter Bray, Alliance Atlantis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Endemol Entertainment, Telecino and Christian Duguay
results.brief_description: This is a lavishly produced, literal interpretation of the life of the 15th century historical heroine Joan d’Arc. In a tiny village during the Hundred Years’ War, teenager Joan d’Arc (Leelee Sobieski) has been raised by her parents Peter (Powers Boothe) and Isabelle (Jacqueline Bisset), amidst the wreckage continually wrought by British incursions into the area. A devout girl, Joan experiences visions of St Catherine, which lead her to believe that she may be the “Maid of Orleans”, a mythical figure who will lead France to victory over its enemies. Counseled by her local priest (Robert Loggia), Joan pursues her destiny in spite of her father’s wishes. At first supported only by lowly commoners, Joan comes to the attention of the Dauphin, King Charles (Neil Patrick Harris). He uses Joan to unite his quarreling factions and his generals, at first sceptical, are won over by Joan’s startling victories. Awaiting Joan is a disastrous Parisian campaign and betrayal by the Dauphin which leads to her being burned at the stake for heresy. She was declared a saint nearly 500 years after her death.

results.title: Joan
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Department of Social Security
results.brief_description: One of a series of films created originally for day-time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies. This programme deals with the problems of unmarried mothers and in particular, with Joan, who worked at an assortment of jobs in order to keep her daughter. The film looks back at her life and at how she and her daughter have come through difficult years. It also highlights a social welfare group known as CHUM - Care and Help for Unmarried Mothers - where social interaction and support are available for women of all ages who are single mothers.

results.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jo Jo White of the Boston Celtics demonstrates the proper ways to pass and dribble and thus establish the ball control capabilities demanded of a good defensive guard. The chest pass, bounce pass, 2-hand overhead pass, hook pass, baseball pass, dribbling techniques and moving without the ball are all shown.

group_siblings.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 1

results.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
A former All-American from the University of Kansas, Jo Jo White of the Boston Celtics illustrates the various techniques of shooting usually required of backcourt men - the jump shot, shooting behind a “pick”, shooting behind a screen, shooting a layup and free throw shooting.

results.title: Jirrupin Bunggul 'Happy Dance'
results.brief_description: Winner of the ‘Make a stamp come alive’ category of Screen It! This cool little work combines a thumping dance track with animation of the artwork depicted on an Australian stamp entitled ‘Aboriginal Culture: Music and Dance’. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Jiri Trnka's puppets
results.brief_description: The art of Jiri Trnka the film puppeteer is cleverly and beautifully presented, showing several extracts from past and forthcoming productions, and including many puppets, some now in `retirement’. Trnka is shown at work in the studio and the mechanics of his art are simply but completely presented. An actual scene under production is discussed and analysed.
